qas.question: Which coat is more common with dogs living in colder climates?
Along with a gruff guard hair, what else makes up the double coat?
What is the more common coat for dogs from colder climates?

context: The coats of domestic dogs are of two varieties: "<a0_0><a2_0>double<a2_0/><a0_0/>" being common with dogs (as well as wolves) originating from colder climates, made up of a coarse guard hair and a <a1_0>soft down hair<a1_0/>, or "single", with the <a3_0>topcoat only<a3_0/>.
